utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk. All except Chandler, plus Emma.]

utterances.transcript: Oh hey you guys, I couldn't get a reservation for the night of my birthday, so we have to do dinner Thursday night instead.
Thursday? But that's Halloween.
So?
So spooky, that's all.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [It's just] So spooky, that's all.

utterances.transcript: So, so, is Mike coming to dinner?
No! It's my first birthday with a boyfriend, and he has to work. Uch, I get mad at him, but I think it's a little to soon to show my true colors.
Pheebs, I would make a reservation for five, because one of us has to stay home and watch Emma. Which one of us should go to dinner?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Pheebs, I would make a reservation for five, because one of us has to stay home and watch Emma. (to Ross:) Which one of us should go to dinner?

utterances.transcript: Oh, Rachel!
Actually, um, I was thinking maybe both of us could go.
Oh, yay!
Thanks, I put a lot of extra thoughts on your gift.
Alright, okay, so we can all go now. That is fun. Hey, you know what? We all haven't been together the six of us in such a long time.
What are you talking about? We're all together right now.
Um, Mon, Chandler's not here.
Oh, dear god!

plots: Rachel is trying to arrange a dinner reservation for a group .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Tulsa, a conference room. Chandler is chairing a group of eight people.]

utterances.transcript: Good morning everyone, it's nice to see our team together for the first time. Now, before we get started, are there any questions? Yes, Ken is it?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Good morning everyone, it's nice to see our team together for the first time. Now, before we get started, are there any questions? (colleague raises hand) Yes, Ken is it?

utterances.transcript: That's right. Is it true, that the reason you are here in Tulsa is that you fell asleep in a meeting and took the job without realizing what you were saying yes to?

Well, don't believe everything you hear, Ken. But yeah, that's true. Alright, let's get started, by take a look at last quarter's figures. Ah, Claudia, aren't you supposed to blow smoke up the bosses' ass?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughs) Well, don't believe everything you hear, Ken. (both turning away to files) But yeah, that's true. Alright, let's get started, by take a look at last quarter's figures. (The female next to Chandler starts smoking, towards her:) Ah, Claudia, aren't you supposed to blow smoke up the bosses' ass?

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry. Does the smoke bother you?
No, no, no-no-no. I smoked for years, then I quit. Right now, I can't remember why. You're not allowed to smoke in this office. Not right?
utterances.transcript_with_note: No, no, no-no-no. I smoked for years, then I quit. Right now, I can't remember why. (to everyone:) You're not allowed to smoke in this office. Not right?

utterances.transcript: Yes, in Oklahoma it's legal to smoke in offices with fifteen people or less. Would you like one?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yes, in Oklahoma it's legal to smoke in offices with fifteen people or less. (passing the pack) Would you like one?

utterances.transcript: Alright, lo...look. I don't smoke anymore. But if the rest of you want to light up, go ahead, it's fine. So you all smoke then? That's almost rude, that I'm not.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Alright, lo...look. I don't smoke anymore. But if the rest of you want to light up, go ahead, it's fine. (everyone lights up) So you all smoke then? That's almost rude, that I'm not.

utterances.transcript: That's not true. If you don't wanna smoke ...
Ken, please! No, I can't, I can't smoke. If I smoke, my wife would kill me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (loud) Ken, please! No, I can't, I can't smoke. If I smoke, my wife would kill me.

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry, but isn't your wife back in New York?
I always liked you, Ken.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I always liked you, Ken. (takes a cigarette)

plots: Chandler learns that it 's legal to smoke in offices with 15 people or less in Oklahoma during a work meeting in Tulsa .
Chandler is talked into having a cigarette by one of Chandler 's coworkers .
As Chandler permits everybody to smoke , Chandler ca n't resist it himself anymore and smokes a cigarette .
Claudia asks if her smoking is bothersome .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Bings'. Monica in bathrobe, merely covered. Someone's knocking at the door.]

utterances.transcript: Trick or treat!

Ohh. Oh wait! you guys won't be late for my dinner, will you?

'kay, see you there. Happy humping! Hey...hey! Oh, wow, somebody smoked out here? Oh my god, don't people know, you're not allowed to smoke in public spaces?

I'm gonna go.

utterances.transcript: You don't need a shower.
Alright, the truth is, I soiled myself during some turbulences.

utterances.transcript: What do I smell? I smell smoke. Huh-did you smoke?

utterances.transcript: Yes, but I just had one. Two. Two tiny cigarettes. Okay, five. A pack. Two pack...a...a carton. Three big fat cartons in two days. But it's over, I made a decision, I'm not gonna smoke anymore.

(How many cigarettes are there in one pack and how many packs in one carton in the US?) But it's over, I made a decision, I'm not gonna smoke anymore.

Ubb.

A pigeon, a pigeon. No, no wait, no-no, an eagle flew in. Landed on the stove and caught fire. The baby, seeing this, jumps across the apartment to the mighty bird's aid. The eagle, however, misconstrues as an act of aggression and grabs the baby on its talon. Meanwhile the faucet fills the apartment with water. Baby and bird still up lays are locked in a death grip, swirling around the whirl pool, that fills the apartment.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Joey) You not gonna believe this: She lied! She tricked me into having sex with her.

utterances.transcript: So? Did have sex, right?
What's the matter with me? Why I'm such a girl?
Okay, that was Mike.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (returns) Okay, that was Mike.

utterances.transcript: Phoebe, hi, we're so sorry. You're totally right. We are here one hundred per cent and we love you and we are ready to start your birthday celebration.
Mhuh, guys, that means the world to me. Huh, nkay, I'm gonna take off.
What?
Oh, I love you guys too, but Mike got off work early. Wait. Wait, I'm not t-not that kind of girl that just ditches her friends to be with her boyfriend. You know what? I am. Bye guys! Judy! Bye.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, I love you guys too, but Mike got off work early. Wait. Wait, I'm not t-not that kind of girl that just ditches her friends to be with her boyfriend. You know what? I am. Bye guys! (waves to the bar) Judy! Bye.

utterances.transcript: Oh thank god, if Phoebe's going, can we please take Emma home?
You know, I think that's a good idea-our babysitter just pounded in another Chardonnet. Bye, y'guys.
utterances.transcript_with_note: You know, I think that's a good idea-our babysitter just pounded in another Chardonnet. (both get up) Bye, y'guys.

utterances.transcript: Bye.
See ya. Well, this is just us.
Mhum.
So, I'm, I'm probably still ovulating. Do you want to give it another try?
So you never had sex with a Kennedy, have you?
Do, do you gonna do it now?
We don't have much time. Once the egg descended the oviduct ...
No-ohoh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No-ohoh. (the Bings leave, the waiter comes)

utterances.transcript: I sincerely hope the rest of your party is returning.
Nah, just me. All alone. Dinner for six for one, uh, you boys are about to see something really special.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Nah, just me. All alone. (all the food is served) Dinner for six for one, uh, you boys are about to see something really special.
[Scene: continues, Joey finished everything.]

utterances.transcript: How was everything, sir?
Excellent. The shrew in particular was exclusive.
Well, I hope, you got some room left.
Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday dear ...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (with birthday cake, singing) Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday dear ...

utterances.transcript: Joey! Joey.
... Joey, happy birthday to you.
That's the best birthday ever.
